titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Dodgers photographic portraits ARC.265
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-08-01 16:22:30 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: 39 halftone reproductions of Brooklyn Dodgers publicity photographs dating from circa 1940 to 1957.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1990 and 1991.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Dodgers were a baseball team based in Brooklyn and founded in 1883. Between 1883 and 1931, the team that would become the Brooklyn Dodgers went through numerous monikers including the Bridegrooms, the Superbas, the Robins, and the Trolley Dodgers--purportedly coined for Brooklynites' ability to dodge the dangerous streetcars in Brooklyn. In 1913, the team moved to a new home field, Ebbets Field, and the next year hired Manager Wilbert Robinson (hence the name the Brooklyn Robins) who would become the winningest manager in the teams' history. After 18 years at the helm, Robinson retired as manager in 1931. The following year, in 1932, the team officially became the Brooklyn Dodgers and remained so until the end of 1957 season, when the team was moved to Los Angeles.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library under the object ID prefixes V1990.60 and V1991.92.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Dodgers photographic portraits, ARC.265, Object ID number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection combines the accessions V1990.060 and V1991.092.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Los Angeles Dodgers centennial press kit photographs, circa 1990 (V1991.004)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 39 halftone reproductions of Brooklyn Dodgers publicity photographs dating from circa 1940 to 1957. The collection consists of portraits of team members of the Brooklyn Dodgers. Each portrait is autographed.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
